Summary
I am a junior developer familiar with the fundamentals of MVC and BDD, and constantly pursuing my passion to continuously learn new languages, frameworks and techniques in order to become a better computer programmer. I have always been drawn to tech in all its forms, and over the last year, I've dabbled in many different programming languages and web development platforms. What really excites me about programming is the near-constant sense of working on an elaborate puzzle, and the great satisfaction that comes when all the pieces fit together and the final picture appears.

Check out my code projects by clicking the link below to my GitHub account.

Responsibilities:

The Web Developer will work on both new site projects and operational support requests. This is a hands-on coding role
that requires strong individual contribution and rapid learning of new technologies as you work. You will create custom
Drupal modules and templates using PHP, write JavaScript and jQuery code from scratch, apply look & feel styling using
Compass/SASS, and build code to integrate with internalsystems. You will collaborate daily with project
managers, QA testers, and business owners for project requirements, testing phases, and code deployments. Problem
triage and quick resolution will be needed for any reported site issues.
Create a new PHP site template and write CSS from scratch to show a schedule of games.
Create responsive pages that include editorial content, ads, and pre-built site components.
Create a new editorial form in Drupal for publishing stories, photos, or video.
Retrieve and display live game scores and statistics using AJAX.
Auto import images into Drupal from Getty Images or other image source API.
Write code to integrate with a HTML5/Flash video player, Google DFP ads, and site analytics.
Fix a styling issue specifically for iOS or Android smartphones and tablets.
Key Skills:

2+ years of enterprise-level web experience (high traffic sites, complex UI features)
PHP, JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, JSON/XML are required.
Experience with responsive designs and basic Unix commands is preferred.
Writing custom modules or plugins for Drupal and Wordpress as a back-end CMS is a plus.
Bootstrap, Compass, SASS are a plus.
Git for version control is a plus.
